sentences.en: ...the voting public's antipathy toward the president.
Being feudal, he always has an antipathy towards emerging things and situations.
sentences.cn: 他是个老封建, 对于新事物新形势总是持有抵触的心理.

sentences.en: Caroline had a peculiar antipathy to Donne.
Edgar must shake off his antipathy.
sentences.cn: 埃德加必得消除对他的反感.

sentences.en: He felt a strong antipathy towards them.
He had an antipathy to the sound of his voice.
sentences.cn: 他一听见他的声音就起反感.

sentences.en: Her uncle seemed to regard his sister - in - law with a sort of tacit antipathy.
sentences.cn: 她的叔叔似乎对他那个 嫂嫂 怀有一种不言而喻的嫌恶.

sentences.en: I feel an antipathy against their behaviour.
sentences.cn: 我对他们的行为很反感.

sentences.en: Most people have a natural antipathy of " muddy streams ".
sentences.cn: 大多数人对 “ 浑浊水流 ” 有一种天然的反感.

sentences.en: She'd often spoken of her antipathy towards London.
sentences.cn: 她常提及她对伦敦的反感。

sentences.en: Some people have an antipathy to cats.
Some people have an antipathy to snakes.
There is a built - in, inherent antipathy towards all claims of exclusivity.
sentences.cn: 对于所有的排他性的宣告都有一种固有 、 与生俱来的不容.

sentences.en: There was an undercurrent of antipathy between them.
sentences.cn: 他们两人之间潜伏着一股反感的暗流.
存在着自然而然的同情, 自然而然的反感.

sentences.en: We know now, the natural antipathy you strove against, and conquered, for her dear sake.
sentences.cn: 现在我才明白了你为她的缘故跟发自天性的憎恶作了多少年斗争, 并且克服了它.

words.tran_cn: 格格不入的，怀有反感的；引起反感的；讨厌的

trans.tran_cn: 反感，引起反感的事物，憎恶的对象，<古>（在本性、倾向等方面的）不相容
trans.tran_en: a feeling of strong dislike towards someone or something
